description:
Operations:
- `addItems` adds elements to array
- `removeItems` removes elements from array
- `replaceItems` replaces all matched elements of array
- `uniqueItems` removes duplicated items from array

Array operations are applied only if current field value is array or not set (treated as empty array)

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: filter
members.doc: filter to lookup for items, empty will delete all

members.doc: Filter to edit only selected items

members.doc: replaces all matched elements of array

members.name: uniqueItems
members.doc:
removes duplicated items from array

Default value: false

members.doc: Filter to edit only selected items

members.name: replaceItems

members.name: uniqueItems
members.doc:
removes duplicated items from array

Default value: false

members.name: paging
members.doc: Allow paginating, default: limit = 30 and offset = 0

members.name: paging
members.doc: Allow paginating, default: limit = 30 and offset = 0

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: finishedAt
members.doc: finish time, may be empty until completed

members.name: startedAt
members.doc: start time, may be empty if NEW

members.name: taskSize
members.doc: estimated number of items to be affected by task
